content.description: Follow the corner crack system up to a small roof with good protection above and below the roof. Continue on easier terrain to the anchors shared with Second Breakfast.
Head up past the bolt and into the dihedral.  There's a small roof (crux) at about 15-20'.  Pull that and it's smooth sailing to the top anchor.  Mostly easier with a (fun) 5.9 crux move.
content.protection: 1 bolt (first clip, protect your belayer), pro to 3.5", bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Bag Ends, from the same platform.

content.description:
"Ascend up broken dihedral to stance, then head left past two bolts to the anchor."

- 2008 Ozone Guidebook
content.location: Far left side of Shire Wall, beginning of belay station

content.description: Climb the corner using the crack and face holds.  Crux is at the top with one hard pull.
content.protection: Standard rack, I brought a #3 c4 and used it but mostly smaller stuff.
content.location: obvious corner to the left of Brandy Wine.

content.description: "Wellwisher" 5.6 bolts & gear to 1 inch. Start left of the Bearded Lady. Climb the arete. Gear need after second bolt. Shares anchor with the Bearded Lady. FA Kevin Evansen & Spencer Collins 12-06-18
content.location: First route on the Shire Wall, left of the Bearded Lady

content.description: Move up good side pulls and ledges to a bulge. Bump to thin crimps or reach over the bulge and mantle up past the third bolt. Continue up easier terrain to a gear placement and then the anchor, which is shared with First Breakfast.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a hand sized cam, two bolt anchor.

content.description: Start on the face and quickly gain flakes and cracks with good protection. Work up into the corner to clip the bolt, than up the face to gain the finger crack. Work up to the anchor on thin ledges and the arrete.
content.protection: Gear to 3", one bolt, two bolt anchor.

content.description: Follow ledges up to a nice crack system. Protection high and to the right before you move left to the anchor, which is shared with Merry.

"Head up mossy slab with minimal gear to a small dihedral with good gear. Traverse left toward anchor."

- 2008 Ozone Guidebook
content.location: Right of The Bearded Lady. Second anchor.

content.description: Gear is small and obvious from the ground. Crux is placing and climbing past gear low, then climb the face past 3 bolts to the anchor shared with first and second breakfast.
content.protection: 1 small cam or nut, 3 bolts, 2 bolt anchor

content.description: Follow the bolt line up jugs to a slopey crux, gear placement gets you to the anchors which are shared with Pippin.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to 2", two bolt anchor
